topIssues.title: Knowledge management (RAG) not working (implemented) in 1.0.6
topIssues.author: harperaa
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to get rag working and following docs, but that code is not implemented in 1.0.6.  It appears to be commented as a placeholder in 
 
**To Reproduce**

settings: {
    secrets: {},
    ragKnowledge: true,
  },
  knowledge: [
    {
      directory: 'knowledge/foobar',
      shared: true,
    },
  ],

**Expected behavior**

I expect that it would parse on startup and it was not doing that, as it used to do.  So, I looked into code and found this... summary from claude....

Missing Implementation Locations

  1. AgentRuntime Initialization Missing Knowledge 
  Processing

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 494-651)
  - The AgentRuntime.initialize() method should process
  character.knowledge but doesn't
  - No call to any knowledge processing function during
  agent startup

  2. TODO Comment Confirms Missing Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/specs/v1/index.ts (line 50)
  // TODO: Implement the remaining adapters: ... - 
  knowledge / memory
  This is a developer comment explicitly stating that
  knowledge processing is not implemented yet.

  3. Bootstrap Plugin Missing KNOWLEDGE Provider

  File: /packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/index.ts
  - Multiple message examples reference providers: 
  ['KNOWLEDGE'] in character files
  - But the bootstrap plugin doesn't export any KNOWLEDGE 
  provider
  - Provider list is incomplete - missing the knowledge
  provider entirely

  4. RagService Interface Exists But No Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 52-61)
  interface RagServiceDelegator extends Service {
    getKnowledge(message: Memory, scope?: { roomId?: UUID;
   worldId?: UUID; entityId?: UUID }):
  Promise<KnowledgeItem[]>;
    _internalAddKnowledge(item: KnowledgeItem, options?:
  any, scope?: any): Promise<void>;
  }
  The interface exists but no actual implementation of
  this service.

  5. Missing Functions

  - processCharacterKnowledge() - Referenced in docs but
  doesn't exist anywhere
  - No knowledge file reading/processing logic
  - No connection between character.knowledge array and
  embedding system

  Developer Comments Confirming This

  The codebase has explicit TODO comments indicating that
  knowledge/memory functionality is intentionally 
  unfinished. The character examples even reference
   a KNOWLEDGE provider that doesn't exist, suggesting
  this was planned but never implemented.

topIssues.title: Callback from plugin action not making it to end user response in chat
topIssues.author: jonathanprozzi
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

In using the `plugin-evm` transfer function we expect to see a followup message with either the success or failure of the transaction.

In the plugin's `transfer.ts` callback, we see the following:

https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-evm/blob/6bf9c4c54b9e1a558c7fb092f071f2e374435887/src/actions/transfer.ts#L133

```typescript
 if (callback) {
        callback({
          text: `Successfully transferred ${paramOptions.amount} tokens to ${paramOptions.toAddress}\nTransaction Hash: ${transferResp.hash}`,
          content: {
            success: true,
            hash: transferResp.hash,
            amount: formatEther(transferResp.value),
            recipient: transferResp.to,
            chain: paramOptions.fromChain,
          },
        });
      }
... (other error logging as well)
```

We see the following in our logs (added additional debugging console.log statements):

```bash
LOG:in the transfer action
CALLBACK IN EVM_TRANSFER_TOKENS [AsyncFunction (anonymous)]
in the transferResponse try block
transferResponse try block completed {
  hash: '0xd2680982067e0258612119a58497208428613debcd314d667bd758b93ea86ed8',
  from: '0x7850f8a9825d6dadfF5621300ee11f2dED76b76b',
  to: '0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94',
  value: 20000000000000000n,
  data: '0x'
}
[2025-06-09 19:25:35] INFO: [Eliza] Agent generated response for message. Preparing to send back to bus.
[2025-06-09 19:25:35] INFO: [Eliza] MessageBusService: Sending payload to central server API endpoint (/api/messages/submit):
    channel_id: "93487822-03c0-4119-bffc-13aca04fb41f"
    server_id: "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
    author_id: "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d"
    content: "I'll help you transfer 0.02 ETH to 0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94 on Sepolia. Processing the transaction now."
    in_reply_to_message_id: "18489676-ba76-4673-9a39-9f17fe686bc3"
    source_type: "agent_response"
    raw_message: {
      "text": "I'll help you transfer 0.02 ETH to 0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94 on Sepolia. Processing the transaction now.",
      "thought": "Process ETH transfer request on Sepolia network after checking balance",
      "actions": [
        "REPLY",
        "EVM_TRANSFER_TOKENS"
      ]
    }
    metadata: {
      "agent_id": "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d",
      "agentName": "Eliza",
      "channelType": "DM",
      "isDm": true
    }

```

The transfer is successful, but we only see the initial message of `"text": "I'll help you transfer 0.02 ETH to 0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94 on Sepolia. Processing the transaction now.",` in the Eliza chat interface.

We would expect to see a followup message with the success (or failure) text from the callback in the `transfer.ts` function.

We also triggered an unsuccessful transaction and did not receive a followup error message which the callback suggests we should see.

**To Reproduce**

- Bare Eliza scaffolded as a fresh project with the `plugin-anthropic` and `plugin-evm` added:

```bash
    "@elizaos/cli": "^1.0.6",
    "@elizaos/core": "^1.0.6",
    "@elizaos/plugin-anthropic": "^1.0.0",
    "@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap": "^1.0.6",
    "@elizaos/plugin-evm": "file:../plugin-evm",
    "@elizaos/plugin-knowledge": "^1.0.1",
    "@elizaos/plugin-openai": "^1.0.3",
    "@elizaos/plugin-sql": "^1.0.6",
    "zod": "3.24.2"
```

and the following Character config:

```typescript
 name: 'Eliza',
  plugins: [
    '@elizaos/plugin-sql',
    ...(process.env.EVM_PRIVATE_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-evm'] : []),
    ...(process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-anthropic'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-openai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-knowledge'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-local-ai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.DISCORD_API_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-discord'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TWITTER_USERNAME ? ['@elizaos/plugin-twitter'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-telegram'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.IGNORE_BOOTSTRAP ? ['@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap'] : []),
  ],
  settings: {
    secrets: {},
    chains: {
      evm: ['sepolia'],
    },
    ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
    ANTHROPIC_SMALL_MODEL: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-latest',
    ANTHROPIC_LARGE_MODEL: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-latest',
  },

```
Our private key and RPC are configured and work as the transfer is successful.


**Expected behavior**

Based on the callback in `transfer.ts` we expect to see a followup message indicating the success or failure of the transfer call.

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/06dae3fa-9b2c-4e49-b660-42f2d9f9837f)

At this stage, the transfer succeeds but this is the last message we received.

We would expect that there would be a followup message after this indicating the success or the failure, including (or similar to) the text in the `transfer.ts` callback (in the `plugin-evm` plugin):

`Successfully transferred ${paramOptions.amount} tokens to ${paramOptions.toAddress}\nTransaction Hash: ${transferResp.hash}`

**Additional context**

We're under the impression that this is a core callback issue and not with the `plugin-evm` itself as we're seeing similar behavior with a barebones example using the `plugin-mcp`. This is a more direct and more easily reproducible example to file.

topIssues.title: Creating room via REST API first works but then returns empty rooms array
topIssues.author: exitsimulation
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am creating a room for an existing agent via the Rest API which returns a success response

POST `/api/agents/b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d/rooms` with 
```
{
  "name": "TestRoom",
  "worldId": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000",
  "roomId": "c06bb360-e84f-49ff-b43a-75a9eb6df8f3",
  "enitityId": "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d"
}
```

Response:
```
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "id": "143da10d-b1e5-00cb-b315-a64f6062d9de",
        "name": "TestRoom",
        "agentId": "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d",
        "createdAt": 1749153906448,
        "source": "client",
        "type": "dm",
        "worldId": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000",
        "serverId": "server-1749153906404"
    }
}
```

Now, the strange thing is then when I call the rooms endpoint via GET
`api/agents/b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d/rooms`

I am getting an empty array

```
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "rooms": []
    }
}
```

Also the ID in the success response is not the one that I supplied in the request.

It seems like internally the room has not been created despite the success response?

Is this a bug in the current version? I am on 1.0.4. Any help would be appreciated!

topIssues.title: Unable to load custom characters after upgrading to 1.0.7
topIssues.author: jonathanprozzi
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

After upgrading an existing project to use `@elizaos/core` version `1.0.7`, our custom character is no longer registered as an agent. Opening the chat interface/dev environment on `localhost` only shows Eliza as an agent and not our character. This previously worked with `1.0.6`. 

I tested with a newly scaffolded project and set up a character there as well and noticed the same behavior with only Eliza being shown as an agent.

**To Reproduce**

- Upgrade an existing project to use `"@elizaos/core": "^1.0.7"` or start a fresh one using this version
- Create a new character file with character settings and load that as the agent in the `index.ts`
- Start the server
- Open `localhost` to view the chat/dev environment and check if custom character is there -- we only saw Eliza and not our agent

Code snippets for characters:

`herbert.ts` snippet:

```typescript
export const herbert: Character = {
  name: 'Herbert',
  plugins: [
    '@elizaos/plugin-sql',
    ...(process.env.EVM_PRIVATE_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-evm'] : []),
    ...(process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-anthropic'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-openai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-knowledge'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-local-ai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.DISCORD_API_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-discord'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TWITTER_USERNAME ? ['@elizaos/plugin-twitter'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-telegram'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.IGNORE_BOOTSTRAP ? ['@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap'] : []),
  ],
... (more settings)
}
```

`index.ts`:
```typescript
const herbertAgent: ProjectAgent = {
  character: herbert,
  init: async (runtime: IAgentRuntime) => initCharacter({ runtime }),
};
const project: Project = {
  agents: [herbertAgent],
};
```

**Expected behavior**

- Expected that Eliza would find the new character (Herbert) and register it as an agent (previous behavior in existing project)
- We didn't change any config in the existing project but after upgrading versions we could no longer find/interact with Herbert

**Additional context**

- Tested this with both a newly scaffolded project as well as in an existing project. Our existing project had our custom agent/character loading but I then upgraded to `1.0.7` and Eliza is the only registered agent. Seems to possibly be using Eliza as a fallback and ignoring our custom character files, even though they're being detected when the server starts.

This PR adds everything needed to enable Eilza, a new generally capable and intelligent agent who can self-improve.
